business.headline: India's Q2 GDP slows to 5.4%, hits 18-month low on weak consumptionThe weaker-than-expected GDP growth raises concerns about the sustainability of economic recovery, particularly as key sectors like manufacturing and mining face challenges.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as heavyweight stocks gain; Q2 GDP data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 759.05 points to 79,802.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 216.95 points to 24,131.10. Both the indices had declined roughly 1.5% yesterday.

PAN 2.0 FAQs: Who can apply, QR code feature, and other key detailsPAN 2.0 is a government initiative combining PAN and TAN systems with a QR code for secure and quick identity verification, simplifying taxpayer registration and promoting a tech-driven tax ecosystem.

Sensex surges 800 points: Key factors behind bull run on Dalal StreetStock market today: Sensex and Nifty regained their footing, driven by improved investor sentiment and stock-specific action. Read on to find out the key reasons behind today's rebound on Dalal Street.

Enviro Infra makes solid market debut: Should you hold or book profit?Enviro Infra IPO listing: Shares of Enviro Infra Engineers have dipped slightly following their strong listing, prompting investors to weigh whether to hold onto their shares or book profits.

Adani Green, Adani Energy Solutions: Why these Adani Group stocks are gainingAdani Green Energy led the surge, rising 14.64% to hit Rs 1,247.55. Adani Energy Solutions followed, reaching a day's high of Rs 825.85. Most other Adani Group stocks also registered gains in early trade.

Enviro Infra shares make strong debut, list at 49% premium over IPO priceEnviro Infra Engineers listing: The shares opened at Rs 220 on the NSE, marking a 48.64% jump from the IPO price of Rs 148. On the BSE, the stock listed at Rs 218, reflecting a 47.29% premium.

Sensex rallies 700 points, Nifty above 24,000; Adani stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 663 points to reach 79,702.09 by 10:33 am, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 154.60 points to trade at 24,084.95.

Sensex crashes 1,200 points, Nifty falls below 24,000; IT stocks tumbleAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex ended 1190.34 points lower at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 to settle below 24,000.

Renewable energy stocks could make your portfolio green. 5 reasons whyWith the global shift towards clean energy, renewable energy stocks have proven to be rewarding for many, delivering strong returns.

Infosys, LTIM, HCLTech, TCS: Why IT stocks are tumbling todayInfosys led the decline with a 3% drop, while Tech Mahindra and LTIMindtree were down by 2.5%. HCLTech, MPhasis, and TCS also recorded losses exceeding 2%.

How this firm is blending sustainability in India's alcohol industryThe company's innovative approach, dubbed 'Grain to Glass', is transforming how businesses can contribute to environmental and social development.

Explained: Why newly-listed NTPC Green Energy shares gained 5% todayNTPC Green Energy share price: The latest surge follows NTPC Green Energy's announcement regarding the commercial operation of the first phase of its Shajapur Solar Project in Madhya Pradesh.

Suraksha Diagnostic IPO opens tomorrow: Check price band, issue size, GMPSuraksha Diagnostic IPO: The IPO will open for bidding on Friday and is expected to list on the stock exchanges on December 6, 2024.

Ola Electric shares continue positive rally, rise above Rs 90. Time to buy?Ola Electric share price: With this, the stock has gained over 35% in the last five sessions and has surpassed the Rs 90 target set by Citi on November 26.

Explained: Why LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade  LIC Stock Price: LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade despite a sharp drop in the benchmark stock market indices.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Champions Trophy: Pakistan likely to accept hybrid model, but with conditionsThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reportedly agreed to a hybrid hosting model for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Sources indicate that under the leadership of Mohsin Naqvi, the PCB has stipulated that if India fails to progress in the tournament, the final will be held in Lahore.

Cyclone Fengal landfall in hours, flights hit as rain pounds Chennai  Live UpdatesCyclone Fengal is predicted to make landfall between Karaikal and Mahabalipuram near Puducherry this evening. Several airlines have briefly suspended flight operations in Chennai. Follow our live updates.

RSS urges Centre to 'mobilise global support' for Hindus in BangladeshRSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale condemned the persecution of Hindus in Bangladesh, accusing the Muhammad Yunus government of being a "silent spectator" to the rising violence against the minority community.

BJP sets date for Maharashtra oath as Mahayuti deadlock drags on: SourcesAmid uncertainty over government formation in Maharashtra, BJP sources said the oath-taking ceremony is expected to take place on December 5.

Doing Bongs wrong: Bollywood's portrayal problemBengali characters in Hindi films often face stereotyping, with their portrayal reduced to clichéd tropes that misrepresent their culture, with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 being a recent example. Director Srijit Mukherji discusses the need for authentic representation and shares his views on why such stereotypes still appear.

Why India visit of this tech mogul, who wants to live forever, is creating buzzBryan Johnson in India: Tech millionaire Bryan Johnson, who has started a project called 'Blueprint' to find new ways to reverse ageing, is set to visit India this month and it has generated considerable buzz.

Rahul Gandhi's 'cracked the whip' reply to Congress chief's unity call at meetingDuring a CWC meeting held to analyse Congress's defeats in Haryana and Maharashtra, party chief Mallikarjun Kharge said that infighting was hurting the grand old party and urged leaders to stop making anti-party remarks.

Won't treat Bangladeshi patients: Kolkata hospital after 'insult' to Indian flagAn official of the JN Ray Hospital in north Kolkata said the decision was forced by insults meted out to the Indian flag by Bangladeshi nationals.

A dating dictionary with 10 trending terms to help you survive modern loveIf you've been away from the dating scene for a while, you might feel lost in a sea of quirky terms. Here's your dating dictionary to navigate the maze of modern love.

Victoria's Secret model kidnapped at gunpoint, held hostage in shack: ReportThe Brazilian model, Luciana Curtis, and her husband were eventually released, but not before a terrifying 12-hour ordeal, which included transferring all their money to the miscreants.

Home and office open for you: Priyanka Gandhi's first speech in Wayanad as MPPriyanka Gandhi Vadra portrayed herself as an approachable MP and said the doors of her home and office were open for the people of Wayanad to meet her and share their issues with her.

Video: UP man loads mud on Thar, speeds off on highway, faces legal actionIn the viral video, man can be seen throwing mud at his Mahindra Thar before speeding off on the road. Moments later, he can be seen driving at dangerously high speeds, putting others at risk.

Vir Das meets Vikas Khanna, chef hopes actor will host Oscars nextVir Das, an actor and comedian, visited chef Vikas Khanna in New York after hosting the International Emmys, with Khanna sharing their photo and expressing hopes for Das to host the Oscars next.

Trump's defence pick's mother accuses him of mistreating women for years: ReportDonald Trump's Defence Secretary pick Pete Hegseth, known for his conservative stance, has criticised "woke" military leadership, opposed women in combat roles, and questioned the relevance of international war regulations.

Watch: CNN anchor's viral reaction as Trump border czar threatens to jail mayor CNN host Kasie Hunt expressed shock at border czar nominee Tom Homan's assertion that he would jail Democratic Denver Mayor Mike Johnston should he refuse to comply with the Trump administration's deportation plans.

Election Commission invites Congress team over Maharashtra result concerns on Dec 3The Election Commission told the Congress that all poll procedures followed in Maharashtra during the counting of votes were transparent and assured the party that it would review all its legitimate concerns.

Detox bars, IV drips: Indian wedding hangovers get a swanky cureWedding planners and modern couples have introduced the ultimate antidote to keep the wedding festivities alive the morning after the party: detox bars and IV drips.

Worked hard on that monologue, says Vir Das after Emmys speech goes viralVir Das, the first Indian to host the International Emmys, delivered a viral monologue that humorously addressed various global figures and incidents. He expressed gratitude for the positive reception.

US universities urge Indian, foreign students to rejoin before Trump comebackSeveral top American universities have issued travel advisories, urging international students to return to the country before the inauguration amid fears of potential travel bans.

Sensationalism won't cloud truth: Raj Kundra on ED raids in porn racket caseBusinessman Raj Kundra criticised media reports that linked his wife Shilpa Shetty to the porn racket case and said it was unacceptable. This came a day after ED raids on his offices and residences in the case.

Kalki Koechlin didn't have work for 2 years after DevD, travelled on local trainKalki Koechlin reflected on her early career struggles post-DevD, sharing that she had no work for two years. She used to eat vada pao and travel on local trains to manage her finances.

Outsiders barred in Sambhal till Dec 10, Samajwadi team heading for visit detainedA Samajwadi Party delegation heading to violence-hit Sambhal were detained after the district administration prohibited the entry of outsiders there till December 10, drawing criticism from its chief Akhilesh Yadav.

50-over tour game on Day 2 after rain washes out Saturday in CanberraIndia tour of Australia: The Day 1 of India's warm-up fixture against Prime Minister's XI has been washed out due to rain and the teams will now play a 50-over per side match on Day 2.

Video: Huge fire breaks out at Varanasi railway station, 200 bikes guttedA devastating fire broke out at the Varanasi Cantonment Railway Station's two-wheeler parking lot, reducing nearly 200 two-wheelers to ashes.

Josh actor Sharad Kapoor accused of misbehaving with woman, FIR registeredBollywood actor Sharad Kapoor has been accused of inappropriate behaviour and unwelcome physical contact with a woman at his Mumbai residence. A police case has been filed against him.

Actor Divyenndu joins Ram Charan's RC 16, see first-look posterDivyenndu, known for his role in Mirzapur, has joined Ram Charan and Janhvi Kapoor's RC 16. His character's first look was revealed as filming began in Mysore.

Pics: Zoya Akhtar joins film festival as jury, poses with Andrew GarfieldFilmmaker Zoya Akhtar joined esteemed global jury members like Andrew Garfield and Jacob Elordi at the 21st Marrakech International Film Festival. The event is set from November 29 to December 7, where Akhtar will help select the competition's best film.

BB 18 Day 53: Aditi Mistry evicted, Rajat Dalal hits back at DigvijayIn the Bigg Boss 18 episode on November 29, Aditi Mistry was evicted. On the other hand, tensions flared as Rajat Dalal clashed with Digvijay Rathee over ration distribution.

Youngest IPL crorepati Vaibhav Suryavanshi features in India U19's XI vs PakistanAfter his record-breaking deal in the Indian Premier League 2025 auction, Vaibhav Suryavanshi made it to the playing XI of the India Under 19 team against Pakistan in Asia Cup.

IND vs PAK19: Suryavanshi, Brian Lara fan, not focussing on outside noiseVaibhav Suryavanshi revealed that Brian Lara is his idol and he said that he is not focussing on the outside noise. Suryavanshi became the youngest player to be sold at auction.

England in charge after Woakes, Carse run through New Zealand on Day 3England seized control of the first Test against New Zealand on Saturday, powered by Harry Brook's brilliant 171. The tourists secured a first-innings lead of 151 runs and then restricted the Black Caps to 155 for six by the close of play on day three in Christchurch.

Imran Patel, 35-year-old cricketer, dies of cardiac arrest at Pune stadiumImran Patel, a 35-year-old professional cricketer, died on Wednesday night after suffering a massive cardiac arrest during a league match at Pune's Garware Stadium. While walking back to the pavilion due to chest and arm pain, the opening batsman suddenly collapsed, shocking players and spectators alike.

Pep Guardiola feels past success with Manchester City gives him margin from sackPep Guardiola says Manchester City's six-game winless run means he must prove himself again, crediting his six Premier League titles in seven years for shielding him from greater scrutiny.

Kane Williamson becomes 1st ever New Zealand batter to complete 9000 Test runsKane Williamson became the 1st ever New Zealand batter to complete 9,000 Test runs. He is also the third-joint fastest to do so, having achieved the feat in 103 matches.

IND vs AUS PM's XI, Highlights: Day 1 called off due to relentless rain in CanberraIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Prime Minister's XI Test Highlights: The scheduled play for today has been called off, much to the disappointment of fans. However, the stadium announcer has confirmed that a 50-over-a-side game will take place tomorrow, providing the Indian team with a valuable opportunity to sharpen both their batting and bowling skills. The game is set to begin at 2:40 PM, offering a fresh chance for spectators to witness some exciting cricket action.

Ruud van Nistelrooy appointed as Leicester City managerFormer Manchester United forward Ruud van Nistelrooy was appointed as the new manager of Leicester City, the Premier League club announced on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
